ax-generic.html.title: Generic Rules
ax-generic.html.contents: normalize.css Stylament uses normalize.css for normalizing browser styling. Related Repo [external] n’ize.css Stylament uses n’ize.css to extend basic styling with slots for CSS custom properties. Related Repo [external] :target scss :target { // Give URL fragment target enough air. scroll-margin-block-start: var(--size-12); } The current target element. :not(html, body, div, section, article, nav, main, header, footer, hgroup, ul, ol, menu, dl, dd, dt, li, table, figure, caption, label) scss :not(html, body, div, section, article, nav, main, header, footer, hgroup, ul, ol, menu, dl, dd, dt, li, table, figure, caption, label) { max-inline-size: var(--measure); } Establish a generic measure.

ax-properties.html.title: Custom Properties
ax-properties.html.contents: Basic Design Tokens This token list is inspired by Pollen CSS. :root scss :root { --color-white: #f9fafb; --color-grey-100: #f2f4f5; --color-grey-200: #e8eaed; --color-grey-300: #d4d7dd; --color-grey-400: #a5aab4; --color-grey-500: #767c89; --color-grey-600: #555d6e; --color-grey-700: #3f4754; --color-grey-800: #2c343f; --color-grey-900: #10181c; --color-black: #070f12; --color-grey: var(--color-grey-500); --color-red-300: #fc8181; --color-red-500: #e53e3e; --color-red-700: #c53030; --color-red: var(--color-red-500); --color-green-300: #9ae6b4; --color-green-500: #48bb78; --color-green-700: #2f855a; --color-green: var(--color-green-500); --color-blue-300: #63b3ed; --color-blue-500: #4299e1; --color-blue-700: #3182ce; --color-blue: var(--color-blue-500); --color-pink-300: #fbb6ce; --color-pink-500: #ed64a6; --color-pink-700: #d53f8c; --color-pink: var(--color-pink-500); --color-purple-300: #b794f4; --color-purple-500: #805ad5; --color-purple-700: #6b46c1; --color-purple: var(--color-purple-500); --color-teal-300: #81e6d9; --color-teal-500: #38b2ac; --color-teal-700: #2c7a7b; --color-teal: var(--color-teal-500); --color-yellow-300: #faf089; --color-yellow-500: #ecc94b; --color-yellow-700: #d69e2e; --color-yellow: var(--color-yellow-500); --color-orange-300: #fbd38d; --color-orange-500: #ed8936; --color-orange-700: #dd6b20; --color-orange: var(--color-orange-500); --color-brown-300: #a1887f; --color-brown-500: #795548; --color-brown-700: #5d4037; --color-brown: var(--color-brown-500); } Color Palette Related Pollen [external] Grid Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { --grid-2: repeat(2, minmax(0, 1fr)); --grid-3: repeat(3, minmax(0, 1fr)); --grid-4: repeat(4, minmax(0, 1fr)); --grid-5: repeat(5, minmax(0, 1fr)); --grid-6: repeat(6, minmax(0, 1fr)); --grid-7: repeat(7, minmax(0, 1fr)); --grid-8: repeat(8, minmax(0, 1fr)); --grid-9: repeat(9, minmax(0, 1fr)); --grid-10: repeat(10, minmax(0, 1fr)); --grid-11: repeat(11, minmax(0, 1fr)); --grid-12: repeat(12, minmax(0, 1fr)); } Grid Template Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { --grid-page-width: var(--width-xl); --grid-page-gutter: 5vw; --grid-page-main: 2 / 3; --grid-page: minmax(var(--grid-page-gutter), 1fr) minmax(0, var(--grid-page-width)) minmax(var(--grid-page-gutter), 1fr); } Page Grid Related Pollen [external] Layout Related Pollen [external] Container Widths Related Pollen [external] https://bholmes.dev/blog/alternative-to-css-variable-media-queries/ [external] :root scss :root { @for $i from 1 through 16 { --size-#{$i}: calc(#{0.25 * $i} * var(--line-root-abs)); } --size-full: 100%; --size-screen: 100vw; --size-min: min-content; --size-max: max-content; } Sizes Scale Related Pollen [external] Typography Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { --font-sans: "Source Sans Pro", sans-serif; --font-serif: "Source Serif Pro", serif; --font-mono: "Source Code Pro", monospace; } Font Families Related Pollen [external] Font Weights Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { --letter-xs: -0.05em; --letter-sm: -0.025em; --letter-none: 0em; --letter-lg: 0.025em; --letter-xl: 0.05em; } Letter Spacing Related Pollen [external] Line Height Line heights supporting the vertical rhythm at every step of the scale. Related Pollen [external] https://drewish.com/tools/vertical-rhythm/ [external] Measure Related Pollen (prose width) [external] Wikipedia [external] Web Typography [external] Modular Scale Related Pollen [external] UI Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { --blur-xs: blur(0.333rem); --blur-sm: blur(0.577rem); --blur-md: blur(1rem); --blur-lg: blur(1.732rem); --blur-xl: blur(3rem); } Blur (Backdrop Filters) Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { --easing-standard: cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1); --easing-accelerate: cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 1, 1); --easing-decelerate: cubic-bezier(0, 0, 0.2, 1); } Easing (Transition Curves) Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { --elevation-1: 0 0.0625rem 0.125rem 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.05); --elevation-2: 0 0.0625rem 0.1875rem 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1), 0 0.0625rem 0.125rem 0 rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.06); --elevation-3: 0 0.25rem 0.375rem -0.125rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1), 0 0.125rem 0.25rem -0.125rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.06); --elevation-4: 0 0.75rem 1rem -0.25rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1), 0 0.25rem 0.375rem -0.125rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.05); --elevation-5: 0 1.25rem 1.5rem -0.25rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1), 0 0.5rem 0.5rem -0.25rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.04); --elevation-6: 0 1.5rem 3rem -0.75rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.25); --elevation-7: 0 2rem 4rem -0.75rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2); } Elevation (Drop Shadows) Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { --layer-1: 10; --layer-2: 20; --layer-3: 30; --layer-4: 40; --layer-5: 50; --layer-below: -1; --layer-top: 2147483647; } Layers Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { --radius-100: 100%; --radius-xs: 0.2rem; --radius-sm: 0.4rem; --radius-md: 0.6rem; --radius-lg: 0.8rem; --radius-xl: 1rem; --radius-full: 999rem; } Radius Related Pollen [external] :root scss :root { @for $i from 1 through 8 { --stroke-width-#{$i}: #{0.0625 * $i}rem; } } Stroke Width Scale A scale of stroke widths in steps of 1/16 rem. Logical Design Tokens :root scss :root { --font-body: var(--font-serif); --font-heading: var(--font-sans); --font-display: var(--font-body); --weight-body: var(--weight-regular); --weight-emphasis: var(--weight-bold); --weight-heading: var(--weight-bold); --color-body: var(--color-black); --color-body-negative: var(--color-white); --color-neutral: var(--color-grey); --color-accent: var(--color-grey-700); --color-accent-negative: var(--color-grey-100); --color-mark: var(--color-grey-900); --color-mark-negative: var(--color-grey-300); --color-primary: var(--color-purple); --color-primary-light: var(--color-purple-300); --color-primary-dark: var(--color-purple-700); --color-heading: var(--color-accent); --color-links: var(--color-primary-dark); --color-links-negative: var(--color-primary-light); --color-hr: var(--color-primary); --spacing-block: var(--line-root-abs); --spacing-heading: var(--spacing-block); --spacing-sectioning: calc(2 * var(--spacing-block)); --spacing-inline: 4ch; --inline-padding-default: 0.5ch; --stroke-width-default: var(--stroke-width-2); --stroke-style-default: solid; --stroke-color-default: var(--color-neutral); } Globally available tokens. Save space on smaller screens.

el-document.html.title: General Document Structure
el-document.html.contents: General Document Structure The following rules target elements that are (or should be) unique to each document. In some cases compound selectors are required in order to only select the specific element. Nevertheless, we can address them without any added class specificity. html scss html { font-size: var(--scale-root, 100%); } Document root. Also selectable as :root (which has a higher specificity). Related Spec [external] MDN [external] body scss body { color: var(--color-body); background-color: var(--color-body-negative); // Push down the footer. min-block-size: 100vh; } Content root. Related Spec [external] MDN [external] main scss main { padding-block: var(--spacing-sectioning); } The document’s main content. There can be only one (visible). Related Spec [external] MDN [external] :where(body, body > div) > header scss :where(body, body > div) > header { @extend %clr-accented--inverted; padding-block: var(--spacing-sectioning); } The document’s main header. (There could be more than one. But that would not make much sense.) :where(body, body > div) > footer scss :where(body, body > div) > footer { // Clever sticky footer (https://css-tricks.com/a-clever-sticky-footer-technique/) position: sticky; inset-block-start: 100vh; // Spacing and color. @extend %clr-accented--inverted; padding-block: var(--spacing-sectioning); } The document’s main footer. (There could be more than one. But that would not make much sense.)

el-edits.html.title: Edits
el-edits.html.contents: Edits The ins and del elements represent edits to the document. Related Spec [external] MDN [external] del scss del { background: var(--color-red-300); } Deletion. ins scss ins { background: var(--color-green-300); } Insertion.

el-embedding.html.title: Embedding
el-embedding.html.contents: Embedding Embedding Containers No default styles needed. embed {} iframe {} object {} portal {} Related Spec [external] MDN [external] Multimedia Content No default styles needed. picture {} source {} img {} video {} audio {} track {} map {} area {} Related Spec (images) [external] Spec (embedded content) [external] Spec (media) [external] Spec (image maps) [external] MDN [external] Embedded Fragments of Other Markup Languages No default styles needed. svg {} math {} Related Spec [external] MDN [external]

el-forms.html.title: Form-associated Content
el-forms.html.contents: Form-associated Content These are elements which can be used together to create forms which the user can fill out and submit to the web site or application. Related Spec [external] MDN [external] General form scss form { } The form itself. button scss button { } Button. Submitting the form and other actionns. Labeling & Grouping label scss label { } Label. fieldset scss fieldset { } Fieldset. legend scss legend { } Legend. Inputs input scss input { } Input. textarea scss textarea { } Textarea. select scss select { } Select. Value Lists datalist scss datalist { } Datalist. option scss option { } Option. optgroup scss optgroup { } Optgroup. Outputs meter scss meter { } Meter. output scss output { } Output. progress scss progress { } Progress.

el-grouping.html.title: Grouping Content
el-grouping.html.contents: Block-level Text Content Definition list Self-contained figure Generic block div { /* Don’t style the generic block! */ } List Paragraph Preformatted text Extended quotation Thematic break

el-interactive.html.title: Interactive Elements
el-interactive.html.contents: Interactive Elements These elements help to create interactive user interface objects. Related Spec [external] MDN [external] details scss details { } Details. The details element represents a disclosure widget from which the user can obtain additional information or controls. summary scss summary { } Summary. The summary element represents a summary, caption, or legend for the rest of the contents of the summary element’s parent details element, if any. dialog scss dialog { } Dialog. The dialog element represents a part of an application that a user interacts with to perform a task, for example a dialog box, inspector, or window.

el-scripting.html.title: Scripting
el-scripting.html.contents: Scripting Scripts allow authors to add interactivity to their documents. Elements dedicated to scripting normally do not require styling. script {} noscript {} canvas {} Related Spec [external] MDN [external]

el-sectioning.html.title: Sectioning
el-sectioning.html.contents: Sectioning Heading Content Sectioning Scope Specific Elements Sections

el-tables.html.title: Tabular Content
el-tables.html.contents: Tabular Content The elements here are used to create and handle tabular data (data with more than one dimension). Related Spec [external] MDN [external] table scss table { --border-width: var(--table-border-width, 0rem); border-collapse: collapse; padding: 0; border-spacing: 0; margin-block: calc(-0.5 * var(--border-width)); } The table itself. caption scss caption { margin-inline: auto; } Table caption. thead scss thead { } Table header. tbody scss tbody { } Table body. tfoot scss tfoot { } Table footer. tr scss tr { } Table row. td, th scss td, th { border: var(--border-width) var(--table-border-color) var(--table-border-style); padding: calc(0.5 * (var(--line-root-abs) - var(--border-width))); } Table cells.

el-text.html.title: Text-level Semantics
el-text.html.contents: Inline Text Semantics Altered Baseline Citation Inline Code Data Directionality Emphasis Enhanced Semantics Generic range span { /* Don’t style the generic range! */ } Input/Output Line Breaks Inline Quotation Ruby Terminology

index.html.title: Stylament Documentation
index.html.contents: Stylament A fundament for your document styling. This is gonna be solid. And flexible. At the same time. 😲 Awesome! What? ⚠️ Spoiler ⚠️: Yes, this is yet another HTML & CSS framework. Stylament is a framework or a blueprint for building well-structured and prettily-styled web pages. Why? After decades of using HTML & CSS frameworks like Foundation and Bootstrap, giving fresh candidates like Bulma a try, even fighting popular misconceptions like “utility first” 🙄, I finally wanted to build my own thing. 💪 I am well-aware of the existence of a bazillion of CSS frameworks out there. And I know about the notion that CSS frameworks in general suck. So, who needs another one? – Well, I do. Why? Because it’s probably true: CSS frameworks suck. At least, they tend to be less helpful the more confident you are writing CSS from scratch. In other words: Having your website depend on a CSS framework can quickly become a pain in the ass. Bloated stylesheets, littered mark-up, opinionated solutions you don’t agree with. How does that make sense? Building a CSS framework because CSS frameworks are bad? It’s not that they are intrinsically bad. It’s just that expecting such a framework to fit every use-case is futile. If you want an API (as in, a set of building blocks and means to customize them) that fits (almost) any kind of web document just rely on vanilla HTML and vanilla CSS. It’s as easy as that. But it’s also easy to mess up. Of course, you need to establish reasonable structures for your HTML and CSS. Potentially reusable structures. That’s where your own personal HTML & CSS framework comes into play. Now it makes sense. 😌 That being said, I can’t tell if this project will ever be useful for anyone but me. Maybe people can learn from it, just as I have learned from others. How? 🚧 N. B.: The how is subject to change. A lot. Configure @use "stylament/css/axioms" with ( $config-custom: ( sizes: (xs, sm, md, lg, xl), font-weights: ( light: 300, regular: null, medium: null, semibold: null, bold: null, extrabold: 800, ), modular-scale: ( min: -3, max: 9, factor: 1.5, ), line-heights: ( root: 1.2, ), ), ); @use "stylament/css/elements"; @use "stylament/css/objects"; @use "stylament/css/utilities";

ob-navigation.html.title: Navigation
ob-navigation.html.contents: Main Navigation Bar Rather opinonated styling for the first nav.e-menu. body > nav.e-menu:first-of-type scss body > nav.e-menu:first-of-type { $size: var(--size-8); --item-block-size: #{$size}; --item-line-height: var(--size-3); --item-padding: var(--size-3); --toggle-size: #{$size}; --toggle-padding: var(--size-2); --toggle-background: var(--color-accent-negative); --toggle-shadow: var(--elevation-3); --toggle-folded-shadow: var(--elevation-5); & > menu { box-shadow: var(--elevation-3); & > li { @extend %clr-accented--inverted; transition: all 0.3s var(--easing-standard); &:hover { @extend .clr-accented; } & > a { color: inherit; background-color: transparent; font-weight: var(--weight-emphasis); text-decoration: none; } } } } The first nav.e-menu is implicitly considered the main menu. Navigation Menu Common patterns for navigation menus. Separated into several aspects. $nav-wide scss $nav-wide: map.get(cw.$widths, "sm"); Breakpoint for switching to wide layout. $size scss $size: 2em; Size factor of the menu. nav.e-menu scss nav.e-menu { --item-block-size: #{$size}; display: flex; flex-direction: row; align-items: flex-start; & > input[id^="-toggle-state"], & > label[for^="-toggle-state"] { display: none; } & > menu { flex-grow: 1; } } General navigation menu. This is the basic selector with the basic rules applied. nav.e-menu.\+levelable scss nav.e-menu.\+levelable { & > menu { display: flex; flex-wrap: wrap; & > li { display: block; text-align: center; // Horizontal nav as long as items have enough space. // https://heydonworks.com/article/the-flexbox-holy-albatross/ flex-basis: calc(($nav-wide - 100%) * 999); flex-grow: 1; } } } Levelable Nav. Places items on a horizontal level if enough space is available. nav.e-menu.\+foldable scss nav.e-menu.\+foldable { --toggle-size: #{$size}; /// Places toggle to the inline end (rhs in Latin). &.\+end { flex-direction: row-reverse; } & > label[for^="-toggle-state"] { cursor: context-menu; display: block; & > :first-child, &:empty::after { display: block; position: relative; // Place over backdrop. inline-size: var(--toggle-size); block-size: var(--toggle-size); padding: var(--toggle-padding); border: var(--toggle-border); margin: 0; font-size: calc(var(--toggle-size) - 2 * var(--toggle-padding)); line-height: 1; text-align: center; font-weight: var(--weight-emphasis); transition: all 0.3s var(--easing-standard); background: var(--toggle-background); border-radius: var(--toggle-radius); box-shadow: var(--toggle-shadow); content: var(--toggle-content, "⋮"); } } & > menu { margin-bottom: -100%; // Do not occupy flow space when foldable. max-inline-size: 100%; overflow: hidden; transition: max-inline-size 0.3s var(--easing-standard); } // Special behavior on narrow screen: Act as overlay with backdrop. @media (max-width: $nav-wide) { & > input[id^="-toggle-state"] { // Unfolded state on narrow screen. &:checked { // Use `label` as backdrop. Clicking on it toggles the state. & ~ label[for^="-toggle-state"]::before { content: ""; position: absolute; inset: 0; block-size: 100vh; background: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5); } } // Folded state on narrow screen. (This is the default, as in not checked.) &:not(:checked) { & ~ menu { @include menu-folded; } & ~ label[for^="-toggle-state"] > :first-child, & ~ label[for^="-toggle-state"]:empty::after { @include toggle-folded; } } } & > menu { position: relative; // Place over backdrop. } } // Folded state on wide screen. (Only when explicitly toggled.) @media (min-width: $nav-wide) { & > input[id^="-toggle-state"]:checked { & ~ menu { @include menu-folded; } & ~ label[for^="-toggle-state"] > :first-child, & ~ label[for^="-toggle-state"]:empty::after { @include toggle-folded; } } } } Foldable Nav. Allows to toggle the display of the menu. &.\+end scss &.\+end { flex-direction: row-reverse; } Places toggle to the inline end (rhs in Latin). nav.e-menu.\+sticky scss nav.e-menu.\+sticky { position: sticky; inset-block-start: 0; z-index: 1; } Sticky Nav. Makes navbar stick to the top of the viewport.

ob-special.html.title: More Specific Styling
ob-special.html.contents: Homepage Header body.s-homepage > header scss body.s-homepage > header { @extend .clr-accented; --radius-box: var(--radius-md); --stroke-width-box: var(--stroke-width-8); & > * { @extend .l-center-box; @extend %l-center--intrinsic; } // Any image alone in an hgroup row is considered a logo. hgroup > * > img:only-child { // Size it so that it nicely fits the viewport. max-inline-size: 66vmin; max-block-size: 66vmin; // Don’t measure-limit width of logo container. :has(&) { max-inline-size: none; } } } Special homepage header styles.

undefined.html.title: <un-grouped>
undefined.html.contents: thead + tbody scss thead + tbody { th:first-child { text-align: start; } } Do not center th in vertical tables.
